settings.title: Steel Fire Pit Bowl
settings.subheading:
Looking for something unique? A fire pit bowl might be just the thing.

Fire pit bowls are perfect for the outdoors, whether you choose gas, propane, or another fuel source. They're both beautiful and functional, and because of their round shape, everyone can sit around the fire and enjoy the dancing flames equally.

We have tons of options at the right price point for you. Start shopping now.

settings.title: Steel Wood Burning Fire Pit
settings.subheading:
If grilling outside and charcoal is your thing, then a wood burning fire pit might be in your future.

What's great about steel wood-burning fire pits is that they're perfect for the outdoors. You get that savory smell of real wood smoke combined with the soft breeze and the crackling of the fire.

We have plenty in stock and have sales going that will allow you to save even more — check them out.

settings.title: What is the standard size for a round fire pit?
settings.text:
The standard size for a round fire pit is between 36 and 44 inches, but this is just a rule of thumb. It all depends on where you plan to put the fire pit and how many guests you want to have over.

If you’re planning on having a few small gatherings, then that size should work for you, but for larger gatherings, you might consider a fire pit in the 60 inch range.

settings.title: How to use a small round fire pit
settings.text:
Using a small round fire pit really depends on the model you purchase. For example, if you get a wood-burning fire pit, you’re going to need a lot of wood, a small stack of kindling, and something like cardboard or newspaper to light the kindling.

However, if you have a natural gas fire pit or a propane fire pit, then using them might be as simple as the touch of a button.

settings.title: How much does a restaurant-grade large round outdoor fire pit bowl weigh?
settings.text: Restaurant-grade fire pit bowls can weigh anywhere from 300 to 600 lb — sometimes more, sometimes less, depending on the model. Restaurant-grade fire pits need to be installed by professionals because of their weight.
